question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What position did Joseph Barthélemy hold before 1980?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Unwavering Voice of the Gers: Joseph Barthélemy's Rise to Député

In the picturesque region of Gers, nestled in the southwest of France, a man of unwavering conviction and unrelenting passion for politics emerged to leave an indelible mark on the country's history. Joseph Barthélemy, a French politician and journalist, would rise through the ranks to assume the esteemed position of député du Gers, a testament to his dedication to the people and the land he loved. Born and raised in the Gers, Barthélemy's roots ran deep in the region's rich soil. As a young man, he was drawn to the world of journalism, recognizing the power of the written word to shape public opinion and inspire change. His early years as a journalist honed his skills as a masterful storyteller, allowing him to weave complex narratives that captivated his audience and conveyed the essence of the issues that mattered most. As Barthélemy's reputation grew, so did his involvement in local politics. He became an ardent advocate for the people of Gers, using his platform to amplify their voices and champion their causes. His unwavering commitment to the region and its inhabitants did not go unnoticed, and soon, he was approached by local leaders to run for office. The year was 1936, and France was in the midst of a tumultuous period. The country was grappling with the aftermath of the Great Depression, and the rise of fascist ideologies threatened the very fabric of democracy. Amidst this uncertainty, Barthélemy's message of hope, unity, and progress resonated deeply with the people of Gers. His campaign, built on a foundation of integrity, transparency, and a deep understanding of the region's needs, struck a chord with the electorate. On May 3, 1936, the people of Gers went to the polls, and the results were decisive. Joseph Barthélemy was elected député du Gers, a position that would grant him a seat in the French National Assembly. This milestone marked a turning point in Barthélemy's career, as he became the voice of the Gers in the highest echelons of French politics. As député, Barthélemy remained true to his roots, tirelessly working to address the concerns of his constituents. He championed agricultural reform, recognizing the vital role that the region's farmers played in feeding the nation.
content.source_2: In the spring of 2024, the French political landscape was abuzz with anticipation. The latest elections had just concluded, and the results were about to be announced. Among the hopefuls vying for a seat in the National Assembly was Joseph Barthélemy, a charismatic journalist-turned-politician with a passion for reform. On March 13, 2024, the wait finally ended. The electoral commission declared Joseph Barthélemy the winner of his constituency, and he was sworn in as a member of the French National Assembly. As he took his oath, surrounded by his family, friends, and supporters, a sense of pride and responsibility washed over him. The next decade would be a whirlwind of activity for Joseph. He quickly established himself as a vocal advocate for progressive policies, using his journalistic background to craft compelling arguments and sway his colleagues. His dedication to the people of France earned him a reputation as a champion of the common man. As the years passed, Joseph's influence grew. He became a respected leader within his party, known for his ability to build bridges across the aisle and forge unlikely alliances. His commitment to social justice and environmental sustainability inspired a new generation of politicians, who saw him as a role model and mentor. But as the summer of 2034 approached, Joseph began to feel the weight of his responsibilities. The demands of office had taken a toll on his personal life, and he knew it was time to reassess his priorities. On June 14, 2034, he tendered his resignation as a member of the National Assembly, bringing an end to a remarkable decade of service. As he left the hallowed halls of the Assembly, Joseph felt a mix of emotions: sadness at leaving behind the only life he had known for ten years, but also a sense of excitement and anticipation for the next chapter of his journey. He knew that his time in office had been a mere stepping stone, and that the real work was only just beginning.
